titleStmt.title: The ghost of Richard the Third expressing himselfe in these three parts, [brace] 1. His character, 2. His legend, 3. His tragedie : containing more of him then hath been heretofore shewed, either in chronicles, playes, or poems.
titleStmt.author: Brooke, Christopher, d. 1628.

titleStmt.title: The ghost of Richard the Third expressing himselfe in these three parts, [brace] 1. His character, 2. His legend, 3. His tragedie : containing more of him then hath been heretofore shewed, either in chronicles, playes, or poems.
titleStmt.author: Brooke, Christopher, d. 1628.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G. Eld for L. Lisle and are to be sold in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Tygers head,

notesStmt.note: Added illustrated t.p., with title: Richard the Third.
Signatures: [par.?]⁴ A-G⁴ H⁴(-H4?) I-L⁴ (last leaf blank).
Commendatory verses by Geroge Chapman, William Browne, Francis Dynn, George Wither, Robert Daborne and Ben Jonson.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.
